p: The brains were immediately excised and blotted to remove blood stains. They were cleansed and rinsed in 1.15 % KCl on ice to remove haemoglobin, then weighed. They were immediately sectioned into cerebrum, cerebellum, and midbrain then homogenized in four volumes of the homogenizing buffer (10 mM potassium phosphate buffer, pH 7.4) using a Teflon homogenizer. The homogenates were centrifuged at 12,500 g for 15 min in a cold centrifuge (4 â„ƒ) to obtain the post mitochondrial fractions which collected and used for biochemical analyses.
